intro: Antirhea radiata subsp. haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian antirhea, is a flowering plant native to Haiti and the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its ornamental, showy flowers that are typically red or pink in color. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly serrated margin. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
